erpKey.description:
This is the primary key of the Invoice record. For this field, you should use whatever the invoice's unique
identifying number is in the originating system. Search for a unique, non-changing number within the
originating financial system for this record.
            
Example: If you store your invoice records in a database, whatever the primary key for the invoice table is
in the database should be the "ErpKey".
            
For more information, see [Identity Columns](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/identity-columns).

companyErpKey.description:
The original primary key or unique ID of the company to which this invoice belongs.  This value should
match the [Company ErpKey](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies#erpkey) field on the
[CompanySyncModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies).
            
An Invoice has two relationships: The Company and the Customer.  The field `CompanyErpKey` identifies the
company that created the invoice, and the field `CustomerErpKey` is the customer to whom the invoice
was sent.

customerErpKey.description:
The original primary key or unique ID of the company to which this invoice was sent.  This value should
match the [Company ErpKey](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies#erpkey) field on the
[CompanySyncModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies).
            
An Invoice has two relationships: The Company and the Customer.  The field `CompanyErpKey` identifies the
company that created the invoice, and the field `CustomerErpKey` is the customer to whom the invoice
was sent.

salespersonName.description:
The name of the salesperson that wrote this invoice.  This is just text, it is not a reference to the
"Contacts" table.  You will not receive an error if this field does not match a known contact person.

purchaseOrderCode.description:
The "Purchase Order Code" is a code that is sometimes used by companies to refer to the original PO
that was sent that caused this invoice to be written.  If a customer sends a purchase order to a vendor,
the vendor can then create an invoice and refer back to the originating purchase order using this field.

referenceCode.description:
An additional reference code that is sometimes used to identify this invoice. The meaning of this field
is specific to the ERP or accounting system used by the user.

salespersonCode.description:
A code identifying the salesperson responsible for writing this quote, invoice, or order.  This is just
text, it is not a reference to the "Contacts" table.  You will not receive an error if this field does
not match a known contact person.

invoiceTypeCode.description:
A code identifying the type of this invoice.
            
Recognized Invoice types are:
* `AR Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Company to the Customer
* `AP Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Vendor to the Company
* `AR Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Company given to Customer
* `AP Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Vendor given to Company

InvoiceSyncModel.description:
The InvoiceSyncModel represents information coming into Lockstep from an external financial system or other
enterprise resource planning system.  To import data from an external system, convert your original data into
the InvoiceSyncModel format and call the [Upload Sync File API](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-sync-zip).
This API retrieves all of the data you uploaded in a compressed ZIP file and imports it into the Lockstep
platform.
            
Once imported, this record will be available in the Lockstep API as an [InvoiceModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/invoicemodel).
            
For more information on writing your own connector, see [Connector Data](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/connector-data).

noteId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

tableKey.description:
A Note is connected to an existing item within the Lockstep Platform by the fields `TableKey` and
`ObjectKey`.  For example, a Note connected to Invoice 12345 would have a `TableKey` value of
`Invoice` and an `ObjectKey` value of `12345`.
            
The `TableKey` value contains the name of the table within the Lockstep Platform to which this metadata
is connected.
            
For more information, see [linking metadata to an object](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

objectKey.description:
A Note is connected to an existing item within the Lockstep Platform by the fields `TableKey` and
`ObjectKey`.  For example, a Note connected to Invoice 12345 would have a `TableKey` value of
`Invoice` and an `ObjectKey` value of `12345`.
            
The `ObjectKey` value contains the primary key of the record within the Lockstep Platform to which this
metadata is connected.
            
For more information, see [linking metadata to an object](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

noteText.description: The full text of the note

isArchived.description:
A flag indicating whether this Note is archived (also known as hidden or deleted).  When you call
[ArchiveNote](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/delete_api-v1-notes-id) this field will
be set to true.
            
You should avoid displaying Notes with the IsArchived field set to true in your user interface.

created.description: The date the note was created

createdUserId.description:

modified.description: The date this note was last modified

modifiedUserId.description: The ID of the user who last modified this note

createdUserName.description: The name of the user who created the note

appEnrollmentId.description:
The AppEnrollmentId of the application that imported this record.  For accounts
with more than one financial system connected, this field identifies the originating
financial system that produced this record.  This value is null if this record
was not loaded from an external ERP or financial system.

recipientName.description: The person to whom this note is intended for.

NoteModel.description:
A note is a customizable text string that can be attached to various account attributes
within Lockstep. You can use notes for internal communication, correspondence with
clients, or personal reminders. The Note Model represents a note and a number of
different metadata attributes related to the creation, storage, and ownership of the note.
            
See [Extensibility](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/extensibility) for more information.

For the ID of this record in its originating financial system, see `ErpKey`.

erpKey.description:
The unique ID of this record as it was known in its originating financial system.
            
If this company record was imported from a financial system, it will have the value `ErpKey`
set to the original primary key number of the record as it was known in the originating financial
system.  If this record was not imported, this value will be `null`.
            
For more information, see [Identity Columns](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/identity-columns).

The entry number of this payment application.  This is often a journal entry number, confirmation code,
or other identifying field for this payment application.

applyToInvoiceDate.description: The date this payment was applied to this invoice.

paymentAppliedAmount.description: The total amount that was applied to this Invoice from the Payment.

created.description: Date payment applied record was created.

createdUserId.description: The id of the user who created this applied payment.

modified.description: Date payment applied record was modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The id of the user who modified this applied payment.

The AppEnrollmentId of the application that imported this record.  For accounts
with more than one financial system connected, this field identifies the originating
financial system that produced this record.  This value is null if this record

payment.description: The payment associated with this applied payment

invoice.description: The invoice associated with this applied payment.

PaymentAppliedModel.description:
A Payment Application is created by a business who receives a Payment from a customer.  A customer may make
a single Payment to match an Invoice exactly, a partial Payment for an Invoice, or a single Payment may be
made for multiple smaller Invoices.  The Payment Application contains information about which Invoices are connected
to which Payments and for which amounts.

onMatchAction.description: Indicates what action to take when an existing object has been found during the sync process.

erpKey.description:
This is the primary key of the Payment Application record. For this field, you should use whatever this
transaction's unique identifying number is in the originating system. Search for a unique, non-changing
number within the originating financial system for this record.
            
Since Payment Applications are often considered transactions, a typical value to look for will be
the transaction ID number, the payment confirmation number, or some other record of this payment.
            
For more information, see [Identity Columns](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/identity-columns).

invoiceErpKey.description:
This field indicates which Invoice had its balance reduced by applying this payment.  In this field,
identify the original primary key or unique ID of the Invoice which had its balance reduced.
            
This information lets you track how an invoice was paid. You can identify what proportion of an invoice's
balance was paid by which methods by joining this field to Invoices.
            
This value should match the [Invoice ErpKey](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-invoices#erpkey)
field on the [InvoiceSyncModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-invoices).

paymentErpKey.description:
This field indicates which Payment was used to provide the funds for this payment application. In this
field, identify the original primary key or unique ID of the Payment that was used for this payment
application.
            
This information lets you track how an invoice was paid. You can identify what proportion of an payment's
balance was paid by which methods by joining this field to the Payment.
            
This value should match the [Payment ErpKey](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-payments#erpkey)
field on the [PaymentSyncModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-payments).

entryNumber.description:
The entry number of this payment application.  This is often a journal entry number, confirmation code,
or other identifying field for this payment application.

applyToInvoiceDate.description: The date this payment was applied to this invoice.

paymentAppliedAmount.description: The total amount that was applied to this Invoice from the Payment.

created.description:
If known, the date when this record was created according to the originating financial system
in which this record is maintained.  If the originating financial system does not maintain a
created-date, leave this field null.

modified.description:
If known, the date when this record was most recently modified according to the originating
financial system in which this record is maintained.  If the originating financial system does
not maintain a most-recently-modified-date, leave this field null.

PaymentAppliedSyncModel.description:
The PaymentAppliedSyncModel represents information coming into Lockstep from an external financial system or
other enterprise resource planning system.  To import data from an external system, convert your original data
into the PaymentAppliedSyncModel format and call the [Upload Sync File API](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-sync-zip).
This API retrieves all of the data you uploaded in a compressed ZIP file and imports it into the Lockstep
platform.
            
Once imported, this record will be available in the Lockstep API as a [PaymentAppliedModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/paymentappliedmodel).
            
For more information on writing your own connector, see [Connector Data](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/connector-data).

account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

unappliedAmount.description: The total unapplied amount in the group's base currency.

paymentType.description:
The type of payment, AR Payment or AP Payment.
            
Recognized PaymentType values are:
* `AR Payment` - A payment made by a Customer to the Company
* `AP Payment` - A payment made by the Company to a Vendor

tenderType.description:
Cash, check, credit card, wire transfer.
            
Recognized TenderType values are:
* `Cash` - A cash payment or other direct transfer.
* `Check` - A check payment.
* `Credit Card` - A payment made via a credit card.
* `Wire Transfer` - A payment made via wire transfer from another financial institution.
* `Other` - A payment made via another method not listed above.

fax.description: The fax number of the Customer's Primary Contact.

city.description: The city of the address for the Customer's Primary Contact.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the address for the Customer's Primary Contact.

postalCode.description: The postal/zip code of the address for the Customer's Primary Contact.

countryCode.description: The 2 character country code of the address for the Customer's Primary Contact.

servicerAccountId.description: The servicer account that this instrument belongs to.

instrumentStatus.description:

the availableForCharges property to establish the UI state of the instrument.
Some instruments (for example, GoCardless mandates) may be chargeable in a PENDING state, while others may not.

availableForCharges.description: Whether the payment instrument can be used for billing customers.

instrumentType.description:

An optional set of ISO 4217 currency codes that the instrument can accept.
A null or empty value means there is no restriction.

isOpen.description:
True if this payment includes some unassigned amount that has not yet been applied to an invoice.  If this
value is true, the field `UnappliedAmount` will be nonzero.

memoText.description: Memo or reference text (ex. memo field on a check).

paymentDate.description:
The date when this payment was received.  This typically is the date when an accounting employee recorded
that they received notification that the payment had occurred, whether they were notified by email, postal
mail, or financial transaction notification.

postDate.description:
The date when a payment was posted to a ledger.  This date is often determined by a company's accounting
practices and may be different than the date when the payment was received.  This date may be affected by
issues such as temporary holds on funds transferred, bank holidays, or other actions.

paymentAmount.description: Total amount of this payment in it's received currency.

unappliedAmount.description: Unapplied balance of this payment in it's received currency.  If this amount is nonzero, the field `IsOpen` will be true.

currencyCode.description:
The ISO 4217 currency code for this payment.
            
For a list of ISO 4217 currency codes, see [Query Currencies](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/get_api-v1-definitions-currencies).

bankAccountId.description: The Bank account id for the company to which this payment belongs.

referenceCode.description: Reference code for the payment for the given Erp system.

created.description: The date on which this record was created.

createdUserId.description: The ID of the user who created this payment.

modified.description: The date on which this record was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The ID of the user who last modified this payment.

appEnrollmentId.description:
The AppEnrollmentId of the application that imported this record.  For accounts
with more than one financial system connected, this field identifies the originating
financial system that produced this record.  This value is null if this record
was not loaded from an external ERP or financial system.

currencyRate.description: The Currency Rate used to get from the account's base currency to the payment amount.

baseCurrencyPaymentAmount.description: Total amount of this payment in the group's base currency.

baseCurrencyUnappliedAmount.description: Unapplied balance of this payment in the group's base currency.  If this amount is nonzero, the field `IsOpen` will be true.

serviceFabricStatus.description:
The status of this payment within Service Fabric.
"UNAUTHORISED" "PENDING" "PAID" "PAID_OFFLINE" "FAILED" "CANCELLED" "REJECTED" "REFUNDED" "PARTIALLY" "PARTIALLY_REFUNDED"

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in source ERP.

applications.description:
All applications this payment is associated with.
To retrieve this collection, specify `Applications` in the "Include" parameter for your query.

notes.description:
A collection of notes linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify `Notes` in the
`include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create a note, use the [Create Note](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-notes)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `Payment` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `PaymentId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

attachments.description:
A collection of attachments linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify `Attachments` in
the `include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create an attachment, use the [Upload Attachment](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-attachments)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `Payment` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `PaymentId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

customFieldDefinitions.description:
A collection of custom fields linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify
`CustomFieldDefinitions` in the `include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create a custom field, use the [Create Custom Field](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-customfieldvalues)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `Payment` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `PaymentId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

customFieldValues.description:
A collection of custom fields linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify
`CustomFieldValues` in the `include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create a custom field, use the [Create Custom Field](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-customfieldvalues)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `Payment` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `PaymentId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

PaymentModel.description:
A Payment represents money sent from one company to another.  A single payment may contain payments for
one or more invoices; it is also possible for payments to be made in advance of an invoice, for example,
as a deposit.  The creator of the Payment is identified by the `CustomerId` field, and the recipient of
the Payment is identified by the `CompanyId` field.  Most Payments are uniquely identified both by a
Lockstep Platform ID number and a customer ERP "key" that was generated by the system that originated
the Payment.  Payments that have not been fully applied have a nonzero `UnappliedAmount` value, which
represents a deposit that has been paid and not yet applied to an Invoice.

appEnrollmentId.description: The id of the connected AppEnrollmentModel

erpKey.description: The ErpKey for the object written to the Erp if created

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

message.description: An optional message to return with the result

syncRequestId.description: The id of the SyncRequestModel the requests were added to

results.description: Results from the ERP write operation

PaymentModelErpWriteResult.description: Contains results of a write back request

paymentId.description: The unique identifier of the payment.

createDateTime.description: Date the orginal request was created in ISO 8601 date format.

cancellable.description:
A boolean field indicating whether the payment is in a state that can be cancelled.
All PENDING payments can be cancelled, but other statuses are provider-dependent.

updateDateTime.description: Date the request was last updated in ISO 8601 date format.

initiatedDateTime.description:
The date when the real-world payment request was initiated
(for example, date upon which an invoice was created), ISO-8601 format.
If before 1st January, 1970, initiatedDateTime will be set to null.

dueDate.description: Date the payment is due in ISO 8601 date format. If before 1st January, 1970, dueDate will be set to null.

offlineMethod.description:
The method that was used to pay an invoice outside of Payments Acceptance.
Values: "CASH" "CHEQUE" "DIRECT_CREDIT" "DIRECT_DEBIT" "CARD" "VOUCHER" "CREDIT_NOTE" "UNKNOWN" "OTHER"

otherOfflineMethod.description:
A free text field for describing offline payment methods not covered by the offlineMethod property.
Should only be used with the OTHER offline method.

endToEndIdentifier.description:
Unique identifier assigned by the payment initiator to unambiguously identify the payment.
The identifier is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

instructedAmount.description: An object that represents an amount of money in a specific currency.

fee.description:
The fee levied by the payment provider for the payment, in minor units of the invoice currency.
This will only be available for paid or partially paid invoices.
Not all providers will be able to provide fee information, so this field may be null even for paid invoices.
Where provided, this field will be non-negative.

reportingAmount.description: Net amount and fees as converted into servicer account currency.

paidToDate.description: Amount of the payment that has been paid until now.

outstandingAmount.description: Amount of the payment still outstanding (excluding fees/charges). Maximum value is instructed amount.

refundedAmount.description: Amount of the payment that has been refunded. Maximum value is instructed amount.

debtorPaymentMethods.description:
Array of payment methods which the debtor can choose from in order to pay.
Primarily used to populate the PayNow options page (for example, card, PayPal, ACH).

creditorAccount.description: Details about the creditor requesting the payment.

debtorAccount.description: The details about the debtor receiving the payment request.

remittanceInformation.description:
Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle,
such as a commercial invoice.

risk.description: Information related to the risk of the payment.

metadata.description: Base64 encoded strings that when decoded, can be added to html emails to provider markup in supported email clients.

partialPayment.description: Flag of whether this is a partial payment

type.description:
The type of the payment.
Values: "INVOICE" "STATEMENT" "PAY_ON_ACCOUNT"

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

memoText.description: Memo or reference text (ex. memo field on a check).

referenceCode.description: Reference code for the payment for the given Erp system.

tenderType.description: The tender type of payment (Cash, Check, etc.)

paymentType.description: The type of payment, AR Payment or AP Payment.

currencyCode.description: The currency code of the payment.

baseCurrencyCode.description: The base currency code of the group.

baseCurrencyPaymentAmount.description: The payment amount in the group's base currency.

baseCurrencyUnappliedAmount.description: The unapplied amount in the group's base currency.

isOpen.description:
True if this payment includes some unassigned amount that has not yet been applied to an invoice.  If this
value is true, the field `UnappliedAmount` will be nonzero.

invoiceCount.description: The number of invoices associated to this payment.

totalPaymentsApplied.description: The number of payments applied to this payment.

invoiceList.description: The reference codes of the invoices associated to this payment.

invoiceIdList.description: The ids of the invoices associated to this payment.

paymentCompanyId.description: The id of the company for this payment.

paymentCompanyName.description: The name of the company for this payment.

supportsErpPdfRetrieval.description:
Specific payments have support for pdf retrieval from their respective erp. When this flag is true, an additional
call to Payments/{id}/pdf can be made to retrieve a pdf directly from the erp.

customerIds.description: The ids of the customer for the associated invoices.

customerNames.description: The names of the customer for the associated invoices.

companyIds.description: The ids of the company for the associated invoices.

companyNames.description: The names of the company for the associated invoices.

modified.description: The modified date of the payment

PaymentSummaryModel.description: Contains summary information for a Payment

summary.description: The totals for a Payment Summary

PaymentSummaryTotalsModel.description: The totals for a Payment Summary

onMatchAction.description: Indicates what action to take when an existing object has been found during the sync process.

erpKey.description:
This is the primary key of the Payment record. For this field, you should use whatever the payment's unique
identifying number is in the originating system. Search for a unique, non-changing number within the
originating financial system for this record.
            
Example: If you store your payment records in a database, whatever the primary key for the payment table is
in the database should be the "ErpKey".
            
For more information, see [Identity Columns](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/identity-columns).

companyErpKey.description:
The original primary key or unique ID of the company to which this payment belongs.  This value should
match the [Company ErpKey](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies#erpkey) field on the
[CompanySyncModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/importing-companies).

paymentType.description:
The type of payment, AR Payment or AP Payment.
            
Recognized PaymentType values are:
* `AR Payment` - A payment made by a Customer to the Company
* `AP Payment` - A payment made by the Company to a Vendor

tenderType.description:
Cash, check, credit card, wire transfer.
            
Recognized TenderType values are:
* `Cash` - A cash payment or other direct transfer.
* `Check` - A check payment.
* `Credit Card` - A payment made via a credit card.
* `Wire Transfer` - A payment made via wire transfer from another financial institution.
* `Other` - A payment made via another method not listed above.

isOpen.description:
True if this payment includes some unassigned amount that has not yet been applied to an invoice.  If this
value is true, the field `UnappliedAmount` will be nonzero.

memoText.description: Memo or reference text (ex. memo field on a check).

paymentDate.description:
The date when this payment was received.  This typically is the date when an accounting employee recorded
that they received notification that the payment had occurred, whether they were notified by email, postal
mail, or financial transaction notification.

postDate.description:
The date when a payment was posted to a ledger.  This date is often determined by a company's accounting
practices and may be different than the date when the payment was received.  This date may be affected by
issues such as temporary holds on funds transferred, bank holidays, or other actions.

paymentAmount.description: Total amount of this payment in the payment's currency.

unappliedAmount.description: Unapplied balance of this payment in the payment's currency.  If this amount is nonzero, the field `IsOpen` will be true.

currencyCode.description:
The ISO 4217 currency code for this payment.
            
For a list of ISO 4217 currency codes, see [Query Currencies](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/get_api-v1-definitions-currencies).

created.description:
If known, the date when this record was created according to the originating financial system
in which this record is maintained.  If the originating financial system does not maintain a
created-date, leave this field null.

modified.description:
If known, the date when this record was most recently modified according to the originating
financial system in which this record is maintained.  If the originating financial system does
not maintain a most-recently-modified-date, leave this field null.

referenceCode.description:
A reference code for the payment for the given financial or ERP system.  This can be any value that the
originating system uses to designate the payment, such as a confirmation number or tracking number, that
is different from the `ErpKey` value.

isVoided.description: True if this payment was voided.

inDispute.description: True if this payment is in dispute.

currencyRate.description: The Currency Rate used to get from the account's base currency to the payment amount.

baseCurrencyPaymentAmount.description: Total amount of this payment in the erp's base currency.

baseCurrencyUnappliedAmount.description: Unapplied balance of this payment in the erp's base currency.  If this amount is nonzero, the field `IsOpen` will be true.

bankAccountId.description: Bank account id for the payment.

PaymentSyncModel.description:
The PaymentSyncModel represents information coming into Lockstep from an external financial system or other
enterprise resource planning system.  To import data from an external system, convert your original data into
the PaymentSyncModel format and call the [Upload Sync File API](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-sync-zip).
This API retrieves all of the data you uploaded in a compressed ZIP file and imports it into the Lockstep
platform.
            
Once imported, this record will be available in the Lockstep API as a [PaymentModel](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/paymentmodel).
            
For more information on writing your own connector, see [Connector Data](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/connector-data).

companyId.description: The unique ID of the company associated with this profile.

companyName.description: The short name of the company associated with this profile.

companyLogoUrl.description: The URL of this company's logo, if known.

website.description: Website URL for the company associated with this profile.

description.description: Description of the company associated with this profile.

publicUrlSlug.description: The public url slug for this Public Company Profile.

reference.description: Reference, assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. For example, Invoice ID.

RemittanceInformation.description:
Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the
items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as a commercial invoice.

ReportDepth.description:
The different depths of describing an account. See the Financial Account Model for possible values for each depth
Enum values are:
            
0 - the classification of the account
1 - the category of the account
2 - the subcategory of the account
3 - the account

conversionRate.description: Rate used to convert instructedAmount to reportingAmount.

fundsAvailableDateTime.description: Date the funds will be made available.

ReportingAmount.description: Net amount and fees as converted into servicer account currency.

merchantCategoryCode.description: Category code confirming to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

deliveryAddress.description: Address of a Company, Provider or Customer

RiskInformation.description: Information related to the risk of the payment.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

baseCurrencyCode.description: The base currency code of the group.

reportPeriod.description: The month the risk rate was calculated for

reportDate.description: The month the risk rate was calculated for

invoiceMonthName.description: The string name of the month the risk rate was calculated for

totalInvoiceCount.description: The count of all invoices in the calculation month

totalInvoiceAmount.description: The sum of the total amount for invoices in the calculation month in the group's base currency.

atRiskCount.description: The count of open invoices over 90 days from the calculation month

atRiskAmount.description: The sum of the outstanding balance of open invoices over 90 days from the calculation month in the group's base currency.

atRiskCountPercentage.description: The percentage of all open invoices for the calculation month that are over 90 days based on count

atRiskPercentage.description: The percentage of all open invoices for the calculation month that are over 90 days based on outstanding balance

RiskRateModel.description: Represents a risk rate calculation for a single month

discountAmount.description: The absolute amount to be discounted if this discount is applied. Not required if discountPercentage is provided.

discountPercentage.description: The relative amount to be discounted if this discount is applied. Not required if discountAmount is provided.

untilDateTime.description: The date until the discount is valid.

SettlementDiscount.description: A Service Fabric Settlement Discount object.

taxAmount.description: Tax amount being paid in this payment.

SettlementDiscountsInfo.description: An object that represents all the discounts available for a given payment.

If a success redirect URI is included but no failure URI, the browser will be redirected
to the success URI in case of errors. A failureReason query parameters will be included
in case of errors; see above for possible values. Including a failure URI but no
success URI will generate a 400 error.

SyncEntityResultModel.description: Contains information about a sync process for an entity.

SyncOperationType.description: Possible operation types for a SyncRequest

syncRequestId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

statusCode.description:
The status of processing for this SyncRequest.  When a SyncRequest is created, it is flagged as `Ready`.
When it is picked up for execution, its status moves to `In Progress`.  When it is complete, its status
will move to `Success` or `Failed`.  If another API call cancels the SyncRequest, its status will move
to `Cancelled`.
            
* Ready
* In Progress
* Cancelled
* Failed
* Success

operationTypeName.description: The name of the OperationType for this SyncRequest

operationType.description: Possible operation types for a SyncRequest

processResultMessage.description: Message containing information about the sync request results

failureCount.description: The number of times this Sync Request has failed

runFullSync.description:
A boolean indicating whether a sync from an ERP system should process all the data from the ERP
as opposed to just the delta of changes since the previous sync run

appEnrollmentId.description: The AppEnrollmentId of the AppEnrollment object that executed this sync request

created.description: The date this sync request was created

modified.description: The date this sync request was last modified

modifiedUserId.description: The ID number of the user who most recently modified this sync request.

details.description:
The detailed list of results and errors that occurred during the processing of this SyncRequest.  This
information is available only after the SyncRequest has completed.  You will only be able to fetch this
field if the SyncRequest's `StatusCode` field is set to `Cancelled`, `Success`, or `Failed`.
            
To retrieve this collection, add the keyword `details` to the `include` parameter on your Retrieve or
Query requests.

SyncRequestModel.description:
Represents a Sync action that loads data from a connector into the Lockstep Platform.  Users can
request Sync actions manually using Lockstep Inbox, or via the [Create Sync API](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-sync).
Each Sync action is tied to an [AppEnrollment](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/applications-and-enrollments).
When the Sync action is complete, the field `StatusCode` will be set to either `Success` or `Failed`.
            
You can fetch a list of detailed results for the Sync API by calling Retrieve or Query with an `include`
parameter of `details`.  These detailed results contain line-by-line errors that were detected during
processing of this sync.

appEnrollmentId.description: The unique identifier of the app enrollment that is creating this sync request.

runFullSync.description:
A boolean indicating whether a sync from an ERP system should process all the data from the ERP
as opposed to just the delta of changes since the previous sync run. For the Demo Data Connector, setting this
to True refreshes the data with new dates as opposed to leaving it unchanged.

SyncSubmitModel.description:
A SyncSubmitModel represents a task that loads data from a connector to load into the Lockstep Platform.  Data
contained in a sync will be merged with your existing data.  Each record will be matched with existing data
inside the Lockstep Platform using the [Identity Column](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/identity-columns)
rules.  Any record that represents a new AppEnrollmentId+ErpKey will be inserted.  A record that matches an
existing AppEnrollmentId+ErpKey will be updated, but only if the data has changed.
            
A Sync process permits either a complete data file or a partial / delta data file.  Lockstep recommends
using a sliding time window to avoid the risk of clock skew errors that might accidentally omit records.
Best practice is to run a Sync process daily, and to export all data that has changed in the past 48 hours.

groupKey.description: Group account transaction detail is associated with.

baseCurrencyCode.description: The base currency code of the group.

referenceNumber.description:
An additional reference number that is sometimes used to identify a transaction detail.
The meaning of this field is specific to the ERP or accounting system used by the user.

transactionDetailId.description: The unique ID of the transaction detail record.

transactionDetailAppliedId.description: The unique ID of the entity applying the transaction to the transaction detail record.

transactionId.description: The unique ID of the transaction record.

transactionType.description:
The type of the transaction detail record.
            
Recognized Invoice types are:
* `AR Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Company to the Customer
* `AP Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Vendor to the Company
* `AR Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Company given to Customer
* `AP Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Vendor given to Company
            
Recognized PaymentType values are:
* `AR Payment` - A payment made by a Customer to the Company
* `AP Payment` - A payment made by the Company to a Vendor

transactionSubType.description: Additional type categorization of the transaction.

transactionDate.description: The date when a transaction detail record was reported.

transactionInvoiceDate.description: The date of the invoice associated to the transaction detail record.

currencyCode.description: The currency code of the transaction.

transactionAmount.description: The total value of this transaction detail, inclusive or all taxes and line items.

outstandingAmount.description: The remaining balance of this transaction detail.

baseCurrencyTransactionAmount.description: The total value of this transaction detail, inclusive or all taxes and line items in the group's base currency.

baseCurrencyOutstandingAmount.description: The remaining balance of this transaction detail in the group's base currency.

supportsErpPdfRetrieval.description:
Specific transactions have support for pdf retrieval from their respective erp. When this flag is true, an additional
call to Invoices/{id}/pdf or Payments/{id}/pdf can be made to retrieve a pdf directly from the erp.

TransactionDetailModel.description:
Represents transaction detail information associated to a transaction. This can either be Invoices which are paid with a
Credit Memo or Payment transaction, or Credit Memos or Payments used as payment for an Invoice transaction.

groupKey.description: Group account transaction is associated with.

baseCurrencyCode.description: The base currency code of the group.

referenceNumber.description:
An additional reference number that is sometimes used to identify a transaction.
The meaning of this field is specific to the ERP or accounting system used by the user.

transactionId.description: The unique ID of the transaction record.

transactionStatus.description:
The status of the transaction record.
            
Recognized Invoice status codes are:
* `Open` - Represents an invoice that is considered open and needs more work to complete
* `Closed` - Represents an invoice that is considered closed and resolved
            
Recognized Payment status codes are:
* `Open` - Represents an payment that includes some unassigned amount that has not yet been applied to an invoice
* `Closed` - Represents an payment where `UnappliedAmount` will be zero

transactionType.description:
The type of the transaction record.
            
Recognized Invoice types are:
* `AR Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Company to the Customer
* `AP Invoice` - Represents an invoice sent by Vendor to the Company
* `AR Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Company given to Customer
* `AP Credit Memo` - Represents a credit memo generated by Vendor given to Company
            
Recognized PaymentType values are:
* `AR Payment` - A payment made by a Customer to the Company
* `AP Payment` - A payment made by the Company to a Vendor

transactionSubType.description: Additional type categorization of the transaction.

transactionDate.description: The date when a transaction record was reported.

dueDate.description: The date when a transaction record is due for payment or completion.

daysPastDue.description: The amount of days past the due date the transaction is left un-closed.

currencyCode.description: The currency code of the transaction.

transactionAmount.description: The total value of this transaction, inclusive or all taxes and line items.

outstandingAmount.description: The remaining balance of this transaction.

baseCurrencyTransactionAmount.description: The total value of this transaction, inclusive or all taxes and line items in the group's base currency.

baseCurrencyOutstandingAmount.description: The remaining balance of this transaction in the group's base currency.

transactionDetailCount.description:
The count of items associated to the transaction.
            
Examples:
* Number of payments for an invoice.
* Number of invoices a payment or credit memo is applied to.

supportsErpPdfRetrieval.description:
Specific transactions have support for pdf retrieval from their respective erp. When this flag is true, an additional
call to Invoices/{id}/pdf or Payments/{id}/pdf can be made to retrieve a pdf directly from the erp.

TransactionModel.description:
Represents detailed transaction information which represents either Invoices, Credit Memos or Payments
within the group account.

summary.description: Represents transaction summary information based on the query request within the group account.

statusCode.description:
A code identifying the status of this transcription validation request item.
            
Recognized Transcription Validation Request status codes are:
* `New` - Represents a transcription validation request item that is considered new and needs work to complete
* `In Progress` - Represents a transcription validation request item that is currently being worked on
* `Failed` - Represents a transcription validation request item that could not complete the validation process
* `Complete` - Represents a transcription validation request item that is considered complete and does not need any further work

created.description: The date on which this transcription validation request item was created.

createdUserId.description: The ID number of the user who created this transcription validation request item.

modified.description: The date on which this transcription validation request item was last modified.

modifiedUserId.description: The ID number of the user who most recently modified this transcription validation request item.

TranscriptionValidationRequestItemModel.description: Represents a transcription validation request item to be validated.

transcriptionValidationRequestId.description: The unique identifier of the transcription validation request.

A code identifying the status of this transcription validation request.
            
Recognized Transcription Validation Request status codes are:
* `New` - Represents a transcription validation request that is considered new and needs work to complete
* `In Progress` - Represents a transcription validation request that is currently being worked on
* `Failed` - Represents a transcription validation request that could not complete the validation process
* `Complete` - Represents a transcription validation request that is considered complete and does not need any further work

userId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.
            
This record provides a link to the user's Azure AD B2C OID.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

defaultCurrencyCode.description:
The default currency code used by this user entity.  This value can be overridden
for invoices in a different currency code.
            
For a list of defined currency codes, see [Query Currencies](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/get_api-v1-definitions-currencies) This will be validated by the /api/v1/definitions/currencies data set

locale.description: The IETF language tag for the user's preferred locale.

notes.description:
A collection of notes linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify `Notes` in the
`include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create a note, use the [Create Note](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-notes)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `UserAccount` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `UserId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

attachments.description:
A collection of attachments linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify `Attachments` in
the `include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create an attachment, use the [Upload Attachment](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-attachments)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `UserAccount` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `UserId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

customFieldValues.description:
A collection of custom fields linked to this record.  To retrieve this collection, specify
`CustomFieldValues` in the `include` parameter when retrieving data.
            
To create a custom field, use the [Create Custom Field](https://developer.lockstep.io/reference/post_api-v1-customfieldvalues)
endpoint with the `TableKey` to `UserAccount` and the `ObjectKey` set to the `UserId` for this record.  For
more information on extensibility, see [linking extensible metadata to objects](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

accountingRoleCodeDefinition.description:

To retrieve this collection, specify `AccountingRole` in the "Include" parameter for your query.

UserAccountModel.description:
A User represents a person who has the ability to authenticate against the Lockstep Platform and use
services such as Lockstep Inbox.  A User is uniquely identified by an Azure identity, and each user must
have an email address defined within their account.  All Users must validate their email to make use of
Lockstep platform services.  Users may have different privileges and access control rights within the
Lockstep Platform.

webhookId.description: The WebhookId uniquely identifies the webhook used to send notification that an event action has taken place.

webhookHistoryId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.

requestSent.description: Flag whether request was sent to callback url successfully or blocked by failing or because it was disabled.

isSuccessful.description:
Flag whether webhook notification was successful overall (if webhook disabled should always return true otherwise
depends on the response from the callback url)

responseStatusCode.description: Response status code that is returned when calling a callback url.

processResultMessage.description: Message containing information about the webhook callback results

failureCount.description:
Number of times message failed to be sent over to callback url before succeeding or failing out.
The maximum value should is based on webhook.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp of when a request is sent to a webhook callback.
Contains the last time message is sent if failures occur.

records.description: The records sent with the webhook.

requestMessage.description: The request message sent with the webhook.

responseMessage.description: The response received back from the webhook.

webhookId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

name.description: A name for the webhook subscription.

statusCode.description: The status of the webhook (Active, Inactive, Errored).

statusMessage.description: When the StatusCode is set to Errored a message is supplied for why it was errored.

clientSecret.description:
An secret set during webhook creation that can be used to verify that the notification
is coming from the Lockstep API.

requestContentType.description: The format of the content to be returned in the webhook notifications. Current options are 'Full' or 'Id'.

callbackHttpMethod.description: The HTTP Method to be used on the callback URL for use in notifications (GET, POST, PATCH, PUT).

callbackUrl.description:
The URL where the notification will be sent via the method set in CallbackHttpMethod.
            
When creating a webhook, the Lockstep API will make a call to this url via the method
set in the CallbackHttpMethod property with a query parameter of "code" set to an encoded
string. To successfully create the webhook, the call must return a successful status code
with the query parameter's value as the plain text content.

expirationDate.description:
The expiration date for the given webhook subscription. Once the expiration date passes,
notifications will no longer be sent to the callback url.

retryCount.description:
The amount of consecutive failed notifications, not including the current attempt, before marking the webhook as
errored (i.e. if the value is set to 0, the webhook will be marked errored on the first failure, if the value
is set to 1 the webhook will be marked errored on the second failure, and so on). The maximum retry attempts is 5.

created.description: The date this webhook was created

createdUserId.description: The ID of the user who created this webhook

modified.description: The date this webhook was last modified

modifiedUserId.description: The ID of the user who last modified this webhook

webhookRules.description: A list of Webhook Rules associated with this Webhook.

partitionKey.description: The partition key used for the webhook callback history

WebhookModel.description:
A Webhook is a subscription to receive notifications automatically to the supplied
callback url when changes are made to a supported object.
            
You will need to create at least one Webhook rule to receive notifications when a specific type of object is inserted, deleted, or updated.

webhookRuleId.description:
The unique ID of this record, automatically assigned by Lockstep when this record is
added to the Lockstep platform.

webhookId.description: The unique Webhook ID that will be used to fire the webhook for this rule.

groupKey.description:
The GroupKey uniquely identifies a single Lockstep Platform account.  All records for this
account will share the same GroupKey value.  GroupKey values cannot be changed once created.
            
For more information, see [Accounts and GroupKeys](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/accounts-and-groupkeys).

tableKey.description:
A Webhook rule is setup to be fired based on `TableKey` and `EventType`.
For example, a Webhook setup for when an Invoice is Created would have a `TableKey` value of
`Invoice` and an `EventType` value of `I` (Insert).
            
The `TableKey` value contains the name of the table within the Lockstep Platform to which this metadata
is connected.
            
For more information, see [linking metadata to an object](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

eventType.description:
A Webhook rule is setup to be fired based on `TableKey` and `EventType`.
For example, a Webhook setup for when an Invoice is Created would have a `TableKey` value of
`Invoice` and an `EventType` value of `I` (Insert).
            
The `EventType` value is one of the following:
- I (Insert)
- D (Delete)
- U (Update)
            
For more information, see [linking metadata to an object](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/custom-fields#linking-metadata-to-an-object).

filter.description: An optional Searchlight filter for this webhook rule. See [Searchlight Query Language](https://developer.lockstep.io/docs/querying-with-searchlight)

created.description: The date this webhook rule was created

createdUserId.description: The ID of the user who created this webhook rule

modified.description: The date this webhook rule was last modified

modifiedUserId.description: The ID of the user who last modified this webhook rule

WebhookRuleModel.description:
A Webhook Rule is a subscription to receive notifications whenever a specific event occurs.
            
With the rule, you specify the Table and event you want to subscribe to.
You can also optionally specify a filter to further refine the updates you want to receive.

api_key.description: API Key authentication issued by the Lockstep Platform
api_key.name: Api-Key
